Class Utils

java.lang.Object
pt.up.fe.els2024.utils.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
Utils is a utility class providing common file and path-related methods.

This class contains static methods that help manipulate file paths, file extensions, and file names. It also offers methods to extract directory structures from file paths. These methods are useful for various tasks involving file system operations.

      public Utils()

  • Method Details

    • getFileExtension

      public static String getFileExtension(File file)
      Retrieves the file extension from a File object.

      This method extracts the extension of the given file, returning it in lowercase. If the file does not have an extension, it returns null.

      Parameters:
      file - the File object from which to extract the extension
      Returns:
      the file extension in lowercase, or null if the file has no extension

    • getExtension

      public static String getExtension(String fileName)
      Retrieves the file extension from a file name.

      This method extracts the extension of the given file name, returning it in lowercase. If the file name does not contain a dot (i.e., it has no extension), it returns null.

      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to extract the extension from
      Returns:
      the file extension in lowercase, or null if the file name has no extension

    • removeExtension

      public static String removeExtension(String filePath)
      Removes the file extension from a given file path.

      This method strips the extension from the file path, returning the path without the file extension. If the file path does not contain an extension, it returns the original path.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the file path from which to remove the extension
      Returns:
      the file path without the extension, or the original path if no extension is present

    • extractFileName

      public static String extractFileName(String filePath)
      Extracts the file name (without extension) from a given file path.

      This method extracts the name of the file (excluding any directory structure and extension). If the file path points to a directory or the file path is empty, it returns null.

      Parameters:
      filePath - the file path from which to extract the file name
      Returns:
      the file name without the extension, or null if the path is empty

    • getDirectoryPath

      public static List<String> getDirectoryPath(String path)
      Returns the directory path of the given file path, excluding the file name.

      This method splits the given file path and returns all directories except the last one (which is assumed to be the file name).

      Parameters:
      path - the file path to process
      Returns:
      a list of directories representing the directory path of the file, excluding the file name

    • getDirectory

      public static List<String> getDirectory(String path)
      Splits the given file path into its individual directories.

      This method normalizes the given path by removing any leading or trailing slashes and then splits it into a list of directories. If the path is empty or consists only of slashes, it returns an empty list.

      Parameters:
      path - the file path to split into directories
      Returns:
      a list of directories extracted from the file path

    • extractFolderName

      public static String extractFolderName(String path)
      Extracts the folder name immediately preceding the last segment in a given path.
      Parameters:
      path - the full file path from which to extract the folder name.
      Returns:
      the name of the folder immediately preceding the last segment.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the path does not have enough segments to extract a folder name.

    • stripQuotes

      public static String stripQuotes(String input)
      Removes leading and trailing single or double quotes from the given string.
      Parameters:
      input - the input string, possibly surrounded by quotes.
      Returns:
      the unquoted string, or null if the input is null.

    • extractSanitizedList

      public static List<String> extractSanitizedList(List<String> list)
      Processes a list of strings, removing surrounding brackets and splitting the contents by commas. Each element is sanitized by trimming whitespace and stripping quotes.
      Parameters:
      list - the input list of strings to sanitize.
      Returns:
      a new list of sanitized strings.
